item.title: ::pure command,
item.dc:creator: @_icestorm ~*icestorm*~
item.description:
@_icestorm wrote:

This is how i would do it. First add this with your other commands.
Use this 1 for anyone to use the pure command.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure") && pure == 0){ pure(); } else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure") && pure >= 1){ sM("You Can't Do The Pure Command Again, Sorry!"); }
Use this for Mod+ to use it if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure") && playerRights >= 1 && pure == 0){ pure(); } else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure") && playerRights >= 1 && pure >= 1){ sM("You Can't Do The Pure Command Again, Sorry!"); }
Now search for public void and with those add public void pure() { addSkillXP(14000000, 0); addSkillXP(14000000, 2); addSkillXP(14000000, 3); addSkillXP(14000000, 4); addSkillXP(14000000, 6); pure += 1; sM("You are now a pure."); }
Now search public int until you find something like this public int jungleDemon = 0;
Btw the code above is just a example. Once you found something like that add this public int pure = 0;
Now save compile and your done. Imo this is just a more organized way of doing it.

Read full topic

item.title: ::pure command,
item.dc:creator: @emtrescue emtrescue
item.description:
@emtrescue wrote:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure") && pure == 0){ addSkillXP(300000, 0); addSkillXP(0, 1); addSkillXP(300000, 2); addSkillXP(300000, 3); addSkillXP(300000, 4); addSkillXP(0, 5); addSkillXP(0, 6); addSkillXP(0, 7); addSkillXP(0, 8); addSkillXP(0, 9); addSkillXP(0, 10); addSkillXP(0, 11); addSkillXP(0, 12); addSkillXP(0, 13); addSkillXP(0, 14); addSkillXP(0, 15); addSkillXP(0, 16); addSkillXP(0, 17); addSkillXP(0, 18); addSkillXP(0, 19); addSkillXP(0, 20); addSkillXP(0, 21); addSkillXP(0, 22); addSkillXP(0, 23); addSkillXP(0, 24); sendMessage("."); pure += 1; }

if (command.startsWith("pure") && pure == 1) { sM("You can only use pure once!"); }

sM might be sendMessage depending on your source

and make sure you have declared

public int pure = 0;

and there is no other pubic int pure in your client.java.

[code]if (command.startsWith("pure") && pure = 0) {
pure += 1;[/code]

[code]if (command.startsWith("pure") && pure = 1) {
sM("You can only use pure once!");
}
